data.event: In 2002, the national census put the population of the town of Tororo at about 34,800.

event.title: 2010, the Uganda Bureau of Statistics (UBOS) estimated

data.event: In 2010, the Uganda Bureau of Statistics (UBOS) estimated the population at 42,500.
In 2011, UBOS estimated the mid-year population at 43,700.
The 2014 national population census put the population at 41,906.

event.title: a major cement works, Tororo Cement Limited, that in 2007

data.event: Tororo has a major cement works, Tororo Cement Limited, that in 2007, because of power shortages, could produce only 19,000 metric tonnes of cement daily against an installed capacity of 35,000 metric tonnes.

event.title: was officially opened by the president of Uganda on 25 June 2010

data.event: It is also home to SEBA Foods, a food factory that was officially opened by the president of Uganda on 25 June 2010.
Electromaxx Limited constructed a 20 megawatt thermal plant, Tororo Power Station, that was commissioned in June 2010.
